refnamediv.refpurpose: Describe an Authorization Server or OpenID Provider

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: An OAuth2Provider describes an OAuth 2.0 Authorization Server or an OpenID Provider with which ${projectName} is registered as a OAuth 2.0 client or OpenID Connect relying party.
An OAuth2Provider is generally referenced from an OAuth2ClientFilter.

refsect1.title: Usage
refsect1.programlisting: { "name": string, "type": "OAuth2Provider", "config": { "clientId": expression, "clientSecret": expression, "wellKnownConfiguration": URL string, "authorizeEndpoint": URI expression, "tokenEndpoint": URI expression, "userInfoEndpoint": URI expression, "scopes": [ expression, ... ] "providerHandler": Handler reference } }

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.para: If the provider has a well-known configuration URL as defined for OpenID Connect 1.0 Discovery that returns JSON with at least authorization and token endpoint URLs, then you can specify that URL in the provider configuration. Otherwise, you must specify at least the provider authorization and token endpoint URLs, and optionally the user info endpoint URL.

variablelist.para: The provider configuration object properties are as follows.

listitem.para: A name for the provider configuration.
The client_id obtained when registering with the provider.
The client_secret obtained when registering with the provider.

varlistentry.term: "wellKnownConfiguration": URL string, required unless "authorizeEndpoint" and "tokenEndpoint" are specified

listitem.para: The URL to the well-known configuration resource as described in OpenID Connect 1.0 Discovery.
The URL to the provider's OAuth 2.0 authorization endpoint.
The URL to the provider's OAuth 2.0 token endpoint.
The URL to the provider's OpenID Connect UserInfo endpoint.
Default: no UserInfo is obtained from the provider.
Overrides the list of scopes specified globally in the context where the provider is used.
Default: use the list of scopes specified by the filter using this provider.
Invoke this HTTP client handler to communicate with the provider.
Provide either the name of a Handler object defined in the heap, or an inline Handler configuration object.
Usually set this to the name of a ClientHandler configured in the heap, or a chain that ends in a ClientHandler.
Default: use the default client handler.
